comment: Dr. Cochrane's grading criteria can seem a little arbitrary, and her lack of feedback makes future projects difficult, but this is the kind of class that expands your horizons and makes you glad you've taken it. There's no textbook and no tests, and instead, students do a series of hands-on projects. She's really tough, but it's a good experience.
There are no tests, but there are a lot of projects. She doesn't require a book which is the only plus. She can be very unapproachable also.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: This is the worst teacher I have ever taken. Period. DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR. The class isn't too horribly difficult if there was a professor to actually teach it to you. She is horribly rude, never shows up to class if you have her in the morning, and doesn't even know the material herself. Be prepared to teach yourself if you take her.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Her lectures are bearable. Make sure you read before hand though, she does offer extra credit for those who participate in class. She commutes from Stone Mountain, so she does sometimes cancel class if you have her in the morning. Her tests aren't too bad if you review and read.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Worst class I've ever taken. I haven't learned anything from her. The students teach the class by presenting group projects. She says she doesn't give As. She told me on an assignment I got a 95 because thats the highest grade...I don't understand why she won't give out As or a 100 when the student deserves it. no tests which is awesome.

I took this class expecting it to be an easy A. She took weeks to reply back to emails, and I had to send 2 or 3 to even get a reply. Tests are nothing over what they claim to be over, due to the fact that she assigns the lectures to students on the first day of class and sits at the back of the class room everyday.  DO NOT TAKE!!!!!!!!!!

One of the worst and rudest teachers I've had. She doesn't show any respect to the students and makes the students teach the class. She only taught one lecture and then assigned us groups and made us make a 45 minute presentation that would teach the class and then tested us on whatever she wanted even if we hadn't discussed it in class.

She taught for the first test. After that the class was put into groups and each group had to do a 45 presentation on a module. The remainder of the tests are based on those. It was difficult to know what to study for the test.

Absolutely horrible. DO NOT TAKE. She rarely ever taught us. She would assign groups to teach the class for 45 minutes each day. Because she didn't teach, it was almost impossible to know what was going to be on the tests. Studying basically consisted of reading each module 5 times and hoping for the best.

One of the absolute worst teachers I have ever had.  She's rude and doesn't even teach the class herself - she assigns group projects and makes the students teach.  On top of the fact that she doesn't teach, she also tests on whatever she wants, regardless of whether it was taught or not.  There's no point in going to this class at all.  DON'T TAKE
She is dramatic, just don't talk and you'll be fine. Don't use your phone

Online class. Totally absent for entire class. Never responded to emails or offered ANY feedback (EVER). Entire course was video discussions and reading textbook for the exams. Never graded any discussions timely (exams where multiple choice and auto-graded). The entire class never knew if they were on point or not... APA paper was the most tedious

Terrible teacher. Cool lady but not a good prof. Changed the due dates and never really explained what we were doing or learning. I was always confused in class and we were treated like high schoolers. A lot of busy work was given and quiz questions were ridiculous. She takes a lot of points off for small mistakes. I would not recommend to take.

Horrible. Unless you are able to MEMORIZE everything word for word, you will fail every one of her petty quizzes. Expect to lose points if, when giving a definition, you leave out a single word. Avoid taking her if you like getting good grades.

Worst, most ridiculously petty teacher I've ever had. She asked for the definition of psychology for a quiz, and took 50% off for  a student missing one word on it. Several of her test questions and ALL of her quizzes are full of trick questions. DO NOT RECOMMEND.

Not a fan. The class was hard because you didn't know what you needed to learn. Although her lectures wouldn't bore you to death, it wasn't easy to grasp what would be presented on an exam. It just felt like she was all over the place. I rather have a boring teacher and know what to study. Wasn't the worst, but I'd pick another teacher over her.
I love this professor except for her discussion requirements. If you can't speak up and make sure you're heard don't take her classes!!

Useless - worst professor I've had in 4 years at SPSU.  Late every day but mad at you if you are late - tests are completely subjective, so if you don't answer "opinion" or "in your own words" questions how she wants, it's wrong, even if supported by fact.
Very cool lady, it was only a one hour class but she required you to do 6 hours of community service and 3 meetings for SPA. Very easy got an A. Just do the work.

She doesn't really explain anything in her lectures; just the basics. Its up to you to memorize the textbook. Her tests are short, but easy. Make sure to really focus on the final project and attend all classes.
bad

She is horrible in almost every aspect. No help from her whatsoever. It took four weeks for her to send an unhelpful reply to numerous e-mails. Hard grader and does not make her assignments clear. Stay Away!

Attendance is mandatory, but coming to class yields extra credit. A big percent of the grade is quizzes, but she only gives a few that are hard to pass. The class project is involved and graded toughly. The final is a take-home essay, but the questions are hard. She is also difficult to contact.

I was doing fine in her class...(didn't make a grade on a test lower than 85.) Only had two quizzes for the entire semester which counted for 20% of the grade. On the first quiz over half the class was given grades lower than a 30% because of the same reason-"Answer Unclear" The second quiz was multiple choice and I had a 95 but gota C in the class

Attendence, lateness, cellphone-u lose points. I had family emergency wouldn't accept my paper that i did via email and i sent it before class.  Test are BS.  PPT is bs.  Don't take notes, listen to examples.  READ txtbk.  She avoids stuff she doesn't want to teach but has to do with the course.  Just useless all round teacher!
tests are tricky. study. know the terms. read the chapters and you'll do fine. projects are easy/fun.

Always late to class. Reads from a powerpoint. Forces discussion but doesnt take your comments into consideration. Papers are easy group project every year with people in your same major. Test& quiz questions come from the book & notes only! no room for interpration even though on quizes she askes for things in your own words.(but they dont count).
Her classes aren't always easy, but she will help you anyway she can.

Got help from my bro who has psych deg & she told me i was wrong about simple stuff. Is a meglomaniac dictator. Is wrong about a lot, just ask a doctor who Actually Has a practice.  Doesnt like white folk(males). Grades tardiness but always late herself & runs class late & DO NOT start getting ready if you need to leave because she WILL yell at you
Ok. I am an all A's student and I got a B in her class. In a gen. ed psychology class I got a B! If this doesn't tell you anything I don't know what will. Thanks

Her lectures are vague, which requires you to read the textbook, but the book is about as useful as a roll of toilet paper. The test questions are tricky, with many answers meaning almost the same thing, even two possible truths, but you have to choose the BEST choice. Reading assignments and pop quizzes are annoying. She's always late to class.
Awful teacher. Unfriendly, tests are very tricky, a lot of reading assignments.
Made psychology suck.

This was by far the WORST teacher I have ever had. The test were full of trick questions. She was late everyday. Horrible attitude and hated to be corrected. Takes points off of final grade for attendance. I wish I had checked this website before I signed up for her because I made a HUGE mistake! Do NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!!!!!
Constantly late. Unfair tests. Do not Reccomend

I found her very helpful if you asked questions. She does have a cell phone rule so just turn it off and you are fine. Her tests are multiple choice and so was the final. (which was made up of mostly the old tests) I got an A but you do have to study and show up for class.

She is unorganized, constantly late, and inconsistent. Her abuse of the English language is absolutely shameful. She doesn't respond to email or phone messages in a timely manner, nor does she keep scheduled meetings with students reliably.

I personally liked Cochrane. She is late, so what, it will pay off once or twice a semester. I found the lectures really intresting and if you study the notes youll make a B. The cellphone rule is one that many profs have. Just turn it off, its that simple. Her tests are sometime long but almost always Multiple Choice/FITHB. Great teacher

She had back to back classes, she still managed to be late to the second. My tests were in the 60's though ended up with a B. Those who did good on the test reported she tests heavily on books stuff, less on class notes. Read the pages she points out in class.

Late late late. Comes in 14 minutes late every day. I never got hit by it, but the cellphone rule is bullcrap, she just wants vengence on students who have people who like them. Tests are kinda crazy-questions and content wise. Not reccomended.
the test are hard but the class is intresting. you have to study hard for test and you will get a B.
grading scheme is somewhat inconsistent.Her test preparations are a waste of time.

A nice enough lady, but shouldn't teach. I wrote both my boyfriend and my own paper one time, he got an A+ and I got a C-. What the heck? Studied like crazy for all her exams, never made better than a B+. Got a B in the class. Counts off your grade if your cell phone goes off in class. Always late.
You have to take notes from what she says; she doesn't put much on the board and the tests were really tricky.
you'll get B if you study the book and notes that she gives, besides that the class is boring and fun sometimes.
always late for class, doesn't have a good planning for lecture

Sorry, but this has been my worst experience in two years at SPSU.  As previously stated her tests are simply 'MEANT TO CONFUSE'... Often late to class and forces participation.  Don't bother raising your hand, she'll just call on you.
It is very hard to figure out what to study for tests.  Questions are also misleading.  Also very strict in the class room.  Deducts 2 points from your FINAL GRADE for a ringing cellphone.
VERY tricky tests.  Misleads students (not on purpose).  Not a fun class at all
Tricky and difficult tests, strange grading.  Homework counts as much as the tests.
class is interesting, but tests will dent your grade bigime.  take a different teacher if possible.
VERY tricky test. Not a fun class at all.
ahhhhh call miss clio to see if you will pass this class, its crazy, not easy yet not hard either
No Comments
Confusing tests; Extra credit available, not much work besides studying involved
terrible teaching style.  Test are tricky
